docs.lead_paragraph: Helping to calm jittery financial markets, Alan Greenspan, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, told the Senate Banking Committee today that further rate cuts are possible as long as inflation stays low. While Mr. Greenspan's overall testimony was little different from his statements that spooked the markets on Tuesday, investors nonetheless seized on the Fed chairman's comments today to bid up both bond and stock prices.

headline.main: Greenspan Says Further Cut in Rates Is Possible
